intro: Tylophora tannaensis, commonly known as Tanna's tylophora, is a flowering plant native to the island of Tanna in Vanuatu. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and often showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It is typically found in moist, forested areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
